official-title.#text:
To amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to
		  require the label of drugs intended for human use to contain a parenthetical
		  statement identifying the source of any ingredient constituting or derived from
		  a grain or starch-containing ingredient.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the
			 following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Gluten in Medicine Disclosure Act of
			 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Labeling of
			 source of human drug ingredients constituting or derived from a grain or
			 starch-containing ingredient

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end the
			 following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 502 of the Federal Food, Drug, and
			 Cosmetic Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:502

text.#text:
that is intended
				for human use;

that contains an
				ingredient (other than a polyol) that constitutes or is derived from a grain or
				starch-containing ingredient; and

whose label fails
				to include a parenthetical statement identifying the source of the ingredient
				so constituted or
				derived.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 502(bb) of the Federal Food, Drug,
			 and Cosmetic Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:502/ss:bb

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, shall apply
			 beginning on the sooner of—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Gluten in Medicine Disclosure Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

text.#text:
a
			 date to be determined by the

the date that is 2
			 years after the date of the enactment of this Act.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 2003 IH: Gluten in Medicine Disclosure Act of 2013
